sentences.english: Janie finally cannot resist speaking up, scolding the men.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮最後忍不住，大聲責罵那些男人。

sentences.english: The boss won’t bother scolding you if he wants to fire you.
sentences.chinese: 他說，“如果老闆要炒你魷魚，就不會費勁去責罵你。

sentences.english: Your mother will bawl you out when she sees this mess.
sentences.chinese: 當你母親看到這混亂的局面時她會責罵你的。

sentences.english: Scolding a child will do more harm than good.
sentences.chinese: 嚴厲責罵孩子弊多利少。

sentences.english: Of course, for educating the child, it is sometimes necessary to scold him or even put in a punishment for wrongdoing.
sentences.chinese: 當然，孩子做了錯事，責罵和懲罰有時也是必要的。

sentences.english: Akwan scold Liu Yushao do things always lack of consideration, regardless of the consequences.
sentences.chinese: 阿寬責罵柳餘紹做事欠缺考慮，總是不計後果。

sentences.english: She was scored for staying out late.
sentences.chinese: 她因回家太晚而受到父母的責罵。

sentences.english: Louise got a bum rap for tsimilarg sides with Richard.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯因爲左袒理查德而受到責罵。

sentences.english: Miss Lee bawled me out for being late.
sentences.chinese: 李老師大聲責罵我遲到。

sentences.english: She a excessive toil, asthma will attack, to get BaoMu hate and scold.
sentences.chinese: 她一辛勞過度，哮喘病就發作，惹來鴇母討厭及責罵。

sentences.english: They do not scold them and do not make them attend classes at all.
sentences.chinese: 既不責罵學生也不勉強他們上課。

sentences.english: Bob's father gets after him for tracking mud into the house.
sentences.chinese: 鮑波把泥巴踩進屋裏被父親責罵。

sentences.english: The boy was smacked down by his parents.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子被父母責罵一頓。

sentences.english: The animals are being blamed for a series of home and vehicle break-ins.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲一系列闖如住所和汽車的行爲而受到責罵。

sentences.english: Zina brings beauty nadia, they want to see of wei, the results were servants to scold.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜帶來了美娜，她們要見達偉，結果被僕人責罵。

sentences.english: The old caretaker was always scolding and chiding.
sentences.chinese: 這個老看門人總是責罵，呵叱個沒完。

definition: to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
